title: Beau Ryan says he'd pick comedian Tommy Little to be his teammate on The Amazing Race
text:
Beau Ryan has confessed that as far as The Amazing Race goes, he's better off just hosting the show.

Appearing on The Project on Monday, the 34-year-old former footballer said if he were ever to appear on the series as a contestant though, he'd choose Tommy Little to be his teammate.

But he confessed it would be disastrous: 'We'd just go to Vegas for four weeks and say we did it.'

Host with the most: Beau Ryan has confessed that as far as The Amazing Race goes, he's better off just hosting the show

His candid confession prompted Tommy, 34, to laugh in agreement, as he sat beside his friend.

Earlier in the interview, Beau had the comedian in stitches of laughter after telling him they were both destined for hell.

Beau was asked whether nuns Judy and Therese were destined to win this year's series thanks to 'divine intervention'.

Ready to go: Appearing on The Project on Monday, Beau said if he were ever to appear on the series as a contestant though, he'd choose Tommy Little (right) to be his teammate

'Yeah, well I haven't had a chat to God, because I'm pretty sure I'm going to hell, as you are,' said Beau, gesturing towards Tommy.

He then continued, claiming the nuns left everyone on the show 'surprised' by their prowess.

'I think they look a little bit older than they actually are. They're actually quite athletic,' he continued, prompting Tommy to burst out laughing.

Going down: Earlier in the interview, Beau had the comedian in stitches of laughter after telling him they were both destined for hell

After momentarily composing himself, Tommy told Beau women didn't like being told they looked older than they actually were.

But Beau stood by his words, claiming that even though they looked older, they were actually 'fit' and 'agile'.

His use of the word 'agile' only made Tommy laugh even harder, with the comedian seen crying as he struggled to pull himself together.

Calling in the big guy: Beau was asked whether nuns Judy and Therese were destined to win this year's series thanks to 'divine intervention'

Beau then flashed the camera a cheeky grin, but after looking over at Tommy, he too began to laugh.

Despite his previous career as a professional football player, Beau said he didn't think he would be good on The Amazing Race.

He claimed along with being fit and healthy, you also needed to be 'patient' and 'calm', two things he supposedly isn't.
description: Beau Ryan has confessed that as far as The Amazing Race goes, he's better off just hosting the show. Appearing on The Project, Beau said he'd choose Tommy Little to be his teammate on the show.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
